NEET_Biology_Teacher_Note: Hello students! Waves is a conceptually rich chapter. Focus on the differences between transverse and longitudinal waves, and the factors affecting wave speed. Here are some high-yield questions from previous years.

Student_Tips_on_Wave_Motion.Tip_1: Distinguish Wave Types: Remember that sound waves are longitudinal (cannot be polarized) while light waves are transverse.
Student_Tips_on_Wave_Motion.Tip_2: Speed of Sound: In gases, speed depends on temperature and the nature of the gas, but NOT on pressure (at constant temperature).
Student_Tips_on_Wave_Motion.Tip_3: Beat Frequency: It is the absolute difference between the frequencies of two sound sources: $f_{beat} = |f_1 - f_2|$.
Student_Tips_on_Wave_Motion.Tip_4: Organ Pipes: Fundamental frequency of an open pipe is $v/2L$, and for a closed pipe, it is $v/4L$.
Student_Tips_on_Wave_Motion.Tip_5: Doppler Effect: Pay close attention to the signs in the formula based on the relative motion of the source and observer.
